intro: Tetracera sessiliflora, commonly known as the sessile-flower tetracera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
